Ringler Jr. (1988)
XRingler Jr., William A. Bibliography and Index of English Verse Printed 1476-1558. London: Mansell, 1988 TP 345.5.
_description: Virtuous maidens but wicked wives — seven stanzas rhyme royal

BodArcSelB24.First Lines:
DEuise prowes and eke humyliteeThat maidnys hath In euery
                    wise…
BodArcSelB24.Last Lines:
…Therfor thou from the Ioye of peradiseAnd thyne of spring was
                    banyst for thy vice
BodArcSelB24.Attributed Author: Quod Chaucere quhen he was ryght auisit (f. 120)
BodArcSelB24.Facsimiles:
Boffey,  Julia,  and  A. S. G. Edwards, eds.  
             Chaucer, Works. Bodleian Library MS Arch Selden B.24: Facsimile
                Edition.
         Cambridge: D. S. Brewer, 1995.

Banna.First Lines:
Devyce proves and eik humilitiethat madyns had in everilk
                    wyiss…
Banna.Last Lines:
…quhilk buir the barne that coverit ws frome cairscho beand
                    virgin clenar than scho war
